titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company Papers relating to Charles Ives
AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company Papers relating to Charles Ives
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Emily Daus DiLeo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 00:49

did.unittitle: The AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company Papers Related to Charles Ives

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Mutual Life Insurance Company of New York

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, company memos, and insurance documents. Also included are programs, biographical information, clippings and press releases - ostensibly collected by the insurance company archives. Of particular interest is Charles Ives' own life insurance policy, and training materials that Ives created for his employees.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Charles Ives and Julian Myrick met in 1899, while employed at Charles H. Raymond and Company, general agents for Mutual Life Insurance Company. In 1907, Ives and Myrick started their own agency, Ives and Company, which later became Ives and Myrick, which was owned by Mutual Life Insurance Company.

Ives held firm beliefs about the purpose and value of life insurance, about which he wrote a number of articles. Although Ives was rather reserved, he played an active role in training their agents. Ives and Myrick was a very successful agency, and its employees were fiercely loyal. Charles Ives retired from business in 1930.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series: I. Files and II. Scrapbooks.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Large scrapbook is very fragile and requires staff assistance.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Papers were established in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library in 2018 by Jonathan Cross, archivist at the AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers should consult the Charles Ives Papers (MSS 14), also held by the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains biographical files, files related to the PBS film, "A Good Dissonance Like a Man" (1977), correspondence, company documents, performance programs and press clippings. The correspondence is related to the Ives and Myrick company, while the remainder of the files cover both the Ives and Myrick company and Ives' musical career. Also included is documentation related to Charles Ives' own life insurance policy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Foldering and labels have been maintained from the Mututal of New York Library Historical Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical files; Publications written by Charles Ives; "Dissonance Like a Man" files; Correspondence (1916-1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Publications written about Charles Ives; Performance Programs (1959-1986) and Press Clippings (1930-1974).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press clippings (1975-1977); Press releases (1954); Charles Ives' own life insurance policy; "Death Benefit Folder" for Charles Ives; Training materials for Ives and Myrick insurance agents; company correspondence and memos; Senior thesis, "Can He Let His Children Starve For His Dissonances? The Double Life of Charles Ives" by Jude Webre (Columbia University 2007); Senior essay, "The Background and The Symbol: Charles E. Ives" by Ralph Joseph Moore (Yale College, 1954); Videorecording: "A Good Dissonance Like a Man" (1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The scrapbooks contain financial documents related to Ives and Myrick, clippings, ads, contract templates, form letters, and company correspondence. Also included are folders of loose clippings that were likely removed from the scrapbooks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Scrapbook is very large and fragile. Access must be arranged with the archivist.
